title: A machine learning-based framework for contractor selection and order allocation in public construction projects
research_description: This paper proposes a machine learning-based framework for contractor selection and order allocation in public construction projects. The framework evaluates sustainability, risk, and safety factors while optimizing the contractor selection process.
research_results: The framework improves the efficiency of contractor selection by automating the evaluation process and considering multiple factors such as sustainability and risk, leading to more informed decisions.
future_research: Future research could extend the framework to include other public procurement domains and assess its scalability across different regions and types of construction projects.
